description: Egypt became the second team from Africa to book their place in Russia, topping Group E with a game to spare, to make their first appearance at the tournament for 28 years.
Morocco booked their return to the FIFA World Cup after a 20-year absence, topping Africa Group C, to head to their fifth edition of the tournament..

The first side from Africa to reach Russia, Nigeria continue their impressive run of appearances at the finals, having missed only one tournament - Germany 2006 - since qualifying for their debut in 1994.
Senegal booked their return to the FIFA World Cup after a 16-year absence, topping Africa Group D, to head to their second edition of the tournament.
Tunisia booked their return to the FIFA World Cup after a 12-year absence, topping Africa Group A, to head to their fifth edition of the tournament.
Belgium booked their place at the 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia after a 2-1 win in Greece ensured they were guaranteed top spot in European qualifying Group H.

Croatia booked their spot at Russia 2018 thanks to a 4-1 aggregate play-off win over Greece, having finished second in Europe's Group I to clinch their second-successive appearance at the global finals.

Denmark booked their spot at Russia 2018 thanks to a 5-1 aggregate play-off win over Republic of Ireland, having finished second in Europe's Group E to return to the world finals after missing out on Brazil 2014.

In reaching Russia 2018, by defeating Slovenia at Wembley in their penultimate Group F match, England sealed their spot at their sixth consecutive FIFA World Cup - matching their previous record set between 1950 and 1970.
France clinched their place at the 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia by topping Europe's Group A, continuing a run of appearing at every tournament since 1994.
Reigning FIFA World Cup holders and FIFA Confederations Cup winners, Germany return to Russia in a bid to become the first team to retain the title since Brazil in 1962.
FIFA.com profiles the country's qualification hopes for Russia 2018 and highlights their star players, the coach as well as its footballing history.
Poland booked their return to FIFA World Cup after a 12-year absence, topping European Group E in their final game, to head to their seventh edition of the tournament.
European champions ​Portugal​ booked their spot in Russia after narrowly finishing top of Europe's Group B on goal difference, edging out Switzerland on the final day to avoid the play-offs.
As hosts of the 2018 FIFA World Cup, Russia qualify automatically but FIFA.com profiles the hosts' team as qualifying for the World Cup begins in earnest this year.
FIFA.com profiles the country's qualification hopes for Russia 2018 and highlights their star players, the coach as well as its footballing history.
South Africa 2010 winners Spain earned their place at Russia 2018 by topping Group G, booking their ticket to Russia with a game to spare ahead of Italy.

Sweden booked their spot at Russia 2018 thanks to a 1-0 aggregate play-off win over Italy, having finished second in Europe's Group A to return to the global finals for the first time since Germany 2006.

Switzerland booked their spot at Russia 2018 thanks to a 1-0 aggregate play-off win over Northern Ireland, having finished second in Europe's Group B to clinch their fourth-successive appearance at the global finals.

Australia became the 31st team to secure their place in Russia, coming through as 3-1 winners against Honduras in their intercontinental play-off, following the Socceroos finishing as Asia's best third-place side after a play-off with Syria.
On Monday 12 June, Iran became the first team from the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) to book their place at the 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™.
Japan reached the 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia after their 2-0 win against Australia on 31 August 2017 which sealed progression from Asia's Group B at the third round stage..
Korea Republic reached Russia 2018, to qualify for their tenth FIFA World Cup, becoming the only side outside of Europe and South America to be ever-present since 1986.
Saudi Arabia reached Russia 2018, to qualify for their fifth FIFA World Cup and first since Germany 2006.
Brazil 2014 quarter-finalists Costa Rica earned their return thanks to claiming one of the automatic qualifying spots from the CONCACAF region.
Mexico won through to the 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia with a 1-0 win over Panama on 1 September 2017 securing qualification with three matches remaining.
Panama qualified for their first FIFA World Cup with a dramatic 2-1 win over Costa Rica on the final matchday of CONCACAF qualifying for Russia 2018.
Argentina finished third in the CONMEBOL standings for Russia 2018 qualifying, reaching the tournament on the final matchday with a 3-1 win in Ecuador.
On Tuesday 28 March, Brazil became the first team from CONMEBOL to book their place at the 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™.
Colombia finished fourth in the CONMEBOL standings for Russia 2018 qualifying after reaching the tournament on the final matchday with a 1-1 draw in Peru.
Peru ended their 36-year FIFA World Cup drought by finishing fifth in South American qualifying and subsequently defeating New Zealand 2-0 on aggregate in the intercontinental play-off.
Uruguay finished second in the CONMEBOL standings for Russia 2018 qualifying after reaching the finals on the final matchday with a 4-2 win over Bolivia.
